thread.title: Watch Jimmy Kimmel Surprise Hollywood Tourists By Inviting Them To The Oscars
thread.title_full: Watch Jimmy Kimmel Surprise Hollywood Tourists By Inviting Them To The Oscars

title: Watch Jimmy Kimmel Surprise Hollywood Tourists By Inviting Them To The Oscars
text:
Watch Jimmy Kimmel Surprise Hollywood Tourists By Inviting Them To The Oscars posted by Marc Inocencio - share 
Host Jimmy Kimmel gave a group of unsuspecting Hollywood sightseers the exclusive tour of a lifetime by inviting them to the star-studded 89th Academy Awards Sunday night. 
"They think they're about to walk into an exhibit," Kimmel prepped the celebs inside the Dolby Theatre. "Everybody be quiet, and let's turn [off] the lights, also, so we can really surprise them. On the count three, we'll turn the lights on and everyone yell 'Mahershala.'" Watch @JimmyKimmel and the #Oscars audience surprise a bus full of Hollywood tourists: https://t.co/vG5LjQdCo9 pic.twitter.com/1QXrwJZYUQ — ABC News (@ABC) February 27, 2017 
The wide-eyed tourists, who were equipped with selfie sticks, were able to walk the front row and score some face time with Keith Urban , Nicole Kidman , Emma Stone and her brother, and other a-listers. Gary from Chicago became the standout from the group by recording the moment from his phone with an unfazed look on his face. Watch the tourists enter the Oscars! pic.twitter.com/UbhGjYkKdi — Scott Feinberg (@ScottFeinberg) February 27, 2017 
His finacée Vicki said "that man right there," Denzel Washington , was her favorite actor. Washington then approached the two, grabbed the microphone from Kimmel and said: "I pronounce you husband and wife, kiss the bride.” 
Kimmel then ordered Jennifer Aniston to gift Vicki with her sunglasses, and proceeded to point out celebs in the room, calling Meryl Streep "overrated," and Casey Affleck "a bearded gentlemen [surprisingly] is not a vagrant.” — Deadline Hollywood (@Deadline) February 27, 2017 This was the best part of that bit. #Oscars pic.twitter.com/2KZpAI13ue
